title: Republican senator holds up anti-lynching bill. See Harris and Booker's response.
description: Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY) explains why he is holding up popular bipartisan legislation to make lynching a federal crime. Sen. Kamala Harris (D-CA) and Sen. Cory Booker (D-NJ) take to the floor to respond.

title: 'You sound deranged': Piers Morgan and Rudy Giuliani interview goes off-the-rails
description: On "Good Morning Britain" host Piers Morgan got in a verbal altercation with former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani.

title: UK lawmakers were forced back to parliament. Then a minister fell ill
description: A UK government minister has been tested for the coronavirus and is self-isolating after he was seen sweating in the House of Commons chamber.

title: Thousands of Hong Kongers defy police ban to remember Tiananmen Square
description: Thousands of Hong Kongers defied a police ban Thursday to gather in the city's Victoria Park and mark the 31st anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre.

title: How lavender became a symbol of LGBTQ resistance
description: Every year, as summer beckons, Pride month arrives in a burst of color. Around the world, rainbow flags fly high and revelers turn their faces proudly towards the sky.

title: Diplomats fear crackdwons at home will undermine US authority abroad
Former generals' condemnation of Trump is an unprecedented revolt by ex-military leaders
Drew Brees issues apology for 'insensitive' comments
description: New Orleans Saints quarterback Drew Brees issued an apology Thursday for his "insensitive" comments made yesterday in an interview with Yahoo Finance.

title: Lance Armstrong: The man who 'gained the world but lost his soul'
description: Betsy Andreu is frustrated. She's just watched the first two hours of Lance Armstrong sharing what the disgraced cyclist calls "his truth" in ESPN's recent 30-for-30 documentary. She isn't buying it.

title: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, speaks out on George Floyd's death in graduation address
description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, has delivered a personal message on the death of George Floyd, describing what is happening in the United States as "absolutely devastating."

title: Elephant in Kerala dies after suspected firecrackers hidden in fruit exploded in her mouth
description: The death of a pregnant wild elephant, suspected to have been fatally injured after eating fruit stuffed with firecrackers that exploded in her mouth, has stirred public outrage in India as authorities investigate the incident.

title: Floyd's Covid-19 diagnosis had nothing to do with his death
description: In a week when the attention of Americans abruptly shifted from a paralyzing coronavirus pandemic to outrage over the deaths of black people in police custody, they learned that while George Floyd survived one threat, he was unable live through the other.

title: Dwayne Johnson makes powerful plea for leadership
description: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson took to social media to issue a plea for leadership as protests following the killing of George Floyd continue across the country.

title: Germany hands out cash for electric cars as part of huge new stimulus splurge
description: Germany is spending billions of euros on subsidies that will slash the price of electric cars as part of a huge economic stimulus package that could help automakers such as Volkswagen to sell vehicles that are better for the environment.

title: Summer vacation: What are the risks?
description: In this new normal where everything is a calculation, summer vacation presents a whole host of questions.

title: In India's remote villages, going hungry is as big a fear as catching the coronavirus
description: Bheru Singh lives in Dechu, a desert village in the far west of Rajasthan in India, where summer temperatures rise as high as 50 degrees Celsius (122 degrees Fahrenheit).

title: Why Trump has the FBI, ICE and TSA patrolling Washington streets
description: President Donald Trump's message of law and order has manifested itself in Washington, DC, in a way he's threatened to do in states but has not been able to achieve.

title: 'I demand change now,' says tennis star Coco Gauff in powerful speech to protesters
description: US tennis sensation Coco Gauff has urged people to speak out on the issue of racial injustice as she promised to continue using her platform to fight for change.

title: Beyoncé urges fans to remain 'focused' in fight for justice for George Floyd
description: Beyoncé Knowles-Carter is encouraging her fans to remain "focused" in the fight for justice for George Floyd.

title: A heavily armed extremist movement is gaining traction in the US
description: Benjamin Ryan Teeter was at his home in Hampstead, N.C., when the call to action came. It was an alert from the heart of the raging protests in Minneapolis, posted on an online forum by a fellow member of the Boogaloo movement, a loosely knit group of heavily armed, anti-government extremists.

title: Joshua Kimmich says Bayern Munich is planning to join George Floyd protests
description: Bayern Munich star Joshua Kimmich says the club is planning on joining the protests against George Floyd's death and believes white players should stand with their black teammates in showing solidarity.

title: 'Skin is a terrain'? A pop of color!
description: Nigerian-American artist Toyin Ojih Odutola is known for her rich, textural portraits of black life, layered through intricate ballpoint pen, charcoal and pastel.

title: Putin declares emergency over 20,000 ton diesel spill
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a state of emergency in the Siberian city of Norilsk, after 20,000 tons of fuel spilled into a nearby river from a power station.

title: Madeleine McCann's parents believe new suspect could be 'very significant'
description: The parents of missing British girl Madeleine McCann believe the police announcement of a new suspect is potentially a "very significant" development in the case.

title: Video captures police officer in Florida kneeling on a black man's neck during an arrest
description: A Florida police department has launched an internal investigation after a video surfaced on social media showing a Sarasota police officer kneeling on a black man's neck during an arrest.

title: Has the UK just canceled summer by imposing a 14-day quarantine?
description: Across Europe, beaches are getting ready for their first socially distanced foreign visitors, hotels are airing out rooms and restaurants are laying alfresco tables. With borders now open, the travel industry is trying to salvage as much of the peak tourist season as possible.

title: 37 children injured in a knife attack at elementary school in China
description: An attacker with a knife injured 37 children and two adults at an elementary school in southern China on Thursday, according to a local government statement.

title: Protests grow as military leaders condemn Trump
description: President Donald Trump is facing an unprecedented revolt from the elite corps of ex-military leaders and presidents over his brazen response to mass protests and inflaming of racial divides.

title: How to be anti-racist: Speak out in your own circles
Astronomers confirm Earth-size exoplanet around nearest star and maybe more
description: Astronomers have confirmed the existence of Proxima b, an Earth-size exoplanet orbiting the closest star to our sun.

title: India's cyclone response saves lives. Climate resilient infrastructure will save livelihoods
description: Mumbai avoided the worst of Cyclone Nisarga, which made landfall close to the Indian financial capital in western Maharashtra state on Wednesday, but caused minimal damage, officials said.

title: New Zealand to provide free sanitary products in schools
description: The New Zealand government said Wednesday that it will provide free sanitary products in schools across the country in an effort to tackle period poverty -- where girls or women are unable to afford or access sufficient menstrual hygiene products.

title: Anderson Cooper responds to press secretary comparing Trump to Churchill
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper responds to White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany saying that President Donald Trump's photo-op in front of St. John's Episcopal Church amid the George Floyd protests was akin to Winston Churchill touring the rubble of London during WWII.

title: Indian defense minister says there have been 'significant' Chinese troop movements amid border tensions
description: Chinese troops have moved into a tense, disputed section of the Himalayan border shared by China and India, according to a high-ranking Delhi official.

title: Attorney General explains why it's hard to convict police officers
description: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison explains why his office did not charge the former Minneapolis Police officer who pressed his knee into George Floyd's neck with first-degree murder and why it's difficult to convict police officers.

title: US to block Chinese airlines from flying into the US
description: The US government says it will block Chinese airlines from flying into the US in response to what it says is a policy that has prevented US carriers from service between the two countries.

title: Current and ex-diplomats tell CNN the events at home are 'heartbreaking' -- and undermine their mission
description: Less than 24 hours after law enforcement officials violently dispersed peaceful protesters outside the White House with pepper balls and rubber bullets, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo met with survivors of China's brutal 1989 crackdown on the pro-democracy protesters in Tiananmen Square.

title: Internet mocks Trump's Bible photo-op
description: Twitter users and comics can't stop roasting Trump for brandishing the Bible. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Move over, France. There's a new cheesemaker in town
description: Once the mist clears over the hilly mountaintops, green is all you can see in Dalat, a mountainous region in the Central Highlands of southern Vietnam.

title: Stark contrast in what Trump and Obama said about protests
description: President Trump and former President Obama had very different messages when addressing the protests surrounding the death of George Floyd.
